intro: Pedicularis lanata subsp. pallasii, commonly known as the Pallas's beardtongue, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and showy, two-lipped flowers. The plant typically grows in alpine meadows and rocky habitats at high elevations. Its flowers are usually pink to purple in color and are pollinated by insects such as bees and flies. It is a perennial herb that produces capsule fruits containing numerous small seeds.
